meanings.definition: An event causing great and often sudden damage or suffering.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake was a catastrophe for the small town.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane was a natural catastrophe that devastated the coastline.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a catastrophe when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: Losing the championship game was a catastrophe for the team.
meanings.sent5: The forest fire was a catastrophic event that left the land barren.

meanings.sent1: The play was a catastrophe with actors forgetting their lines.
meanings.sent2: The business deal turned into a catastrophe when the investors backed out.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was a catastrophe with the cake falling on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The experiment was a catastrophe, resulting in a big mess in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The camping trip turned into a catastrophic failure when they got lost in the woods.

meanings.sent1: The tsunami was a catastrophe that affected multiple countries.
meanings.sent2: The pandemic was a global catastrophe that changed the way we live.
meanings.sent3: The snowstorm turned into a catastrophe when the power went out.
meanings.sent4: The volcanic eruption was a catastrophe that covered the entire island in ash.
meanings.sent5: The flood was a catastrophic event that destroyed homes and crops.
